adjectives.description: crappo (comparative more crappo, superlative most crappo)

entries.meaning: (slang) Of very low quality; crap, lousy.

description: Borrowed from Guyanese Creole English crappo, from French crapaud (“toad”), from Middle French crapaud, from Old French crapaut, crapot (“frog; toad”), from Frankish *krappō, *krappa (“claw, hook”) (because of a toad’s hooked feet; possibly from Proto-Indo-European *greb-) + -aud (suffix forming diminutives or nouns having a pejorative connotation). Doublet of crapaud.

entries.meaning: (Caribbean, chiefly Guyana, Trinidad and Tobago) A toad (chiefly from the family Bufonidae).

description: Borrowed from Trinidadian Creole English crappo, crapaud, a modification of either Arawak carapa, kálaba, karaba, or Galibi Carib karapa.

entries.meaning: (Trinidad and Tobago) The andiroba or crabwood tree (Carapa guianensis).
